title: Ticket #3101: Unexpected data while reading an ad off the wire can cause a crash
description: In getOldClassAd(), the call to Stream::get_string_ptr() can return true and give back a NULL pointer. The function is not expecting this and blindly dereferences the pointer. Getting back a NULL pointer shouldn't happen in the normal case, but I'm seeing it occur when a file transfer fails.
